vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐπαφρόδ-ῑτος, ον,
(Ἀφροδίτη) lovely, fascinating, charming, of persons, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of things, ἔπη καὶ ἔργα [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ποίησις [Refs 5th c.BC+]: superlative -ότατος[Refs 5th c.BC+]. adverb -τως, γράφειν [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II used to translate Sulla's epithet Felix, favoured by Venus, i.e. fortune's favourite (metaphorically from the dice), [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__III gracious, ἡγεμονία [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Php.2.25
§ Epaphroditus, "handsome"
Epaphroditus, (Proper name), Phil. 2:25; 4:18*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
以巴弗提 这个陽性專有名詞在希腊文的意思是 "可愛的"
與保羅一起服事的同工
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
以巴弗提 这个阳性专有名词在希腊文的意思是 "可爱的"
与保罗一起服事的同工
